revision.text:
{{wiktionary|Albert|Altti}} '''Albert''' may refer to: {{TOC right}}
==Arts, entertainment, and media==
===Fictional characters=== * [[Albert (comics)]], a fictional character appearing in comic books published by Marvel Comic * [[Albert (Discworld)]], a character in Terry Pratchett's ''Discworld'' series * [[Albert (suspiria)]], a minor character in Dario Argento's 1977 film ''Suspiria'' * Albert, supporting character in ''Josie'' (later ''[[Josie and the Pussycats (comics)|Josie and the Pussycats]]'') * [[Albert Hinkey]], a character in the film ''Cars'' * Albert Ramsbottom, subject of a number of humorous monologues by [[Stanley Holloway]]
===Other uses in arts, entertainment, and media=== * [[Albert (album)|''Albert'' (album)]], by Ed Hall, 1998 * [[Albert (1985 film)|''Albert'' (1985 film)]], a Czechoslovak film directed by František Vláčil * [[Albert (2016 film)|''Albert'' (2016 film)]], an American CGI Christmas-themed musical comedy TV movie * [[Albert (short story)|"Albert" (short story)]], by Leo Tolstoy * [[Albert Productions]], a record label * ''[[Albert the Fifth Musketeer]]'', a 1993 French animated TV series
==People== * [[Albert (dancer)]] (François-Ferdinand 1789–1865), French ballet master * [[Albert (given name)]] * [[Albert (surname)]]
==Places== ===Australia=== * [[Albert, New South Wales]], a town in Australia * [[Electoral district of Albert]], a former electoral district in Queensland, Australia
===Canada=== * [[Albert (1846-1973 electoral district)]], a provincial electoral district in New Brunswick from 1846 to 1973 * [[Albert (electoral district)]], a federal electoral district in New Brunswick from 1867 to 1903 * [[Albert (provincial electoral district)]], a provincial electoral district in New Brunswick * [[Albert County, New Brunswick]] * [[Rural Municipality of Albert]], Manitoba, Canada
===United States=== * [[Albert, Kansas]] * [[Albert, Oklahoma]] * [[Albert, Texas]], a ghost town * [[Albert Township, Michigan]]
===Elsewhere=== * [[Albert (Belize House constituency)]], a Belize City-based electoral constituency * [[Albert (crater)]], a lunar crater * [[Albert, Somme]] a French Commune, site of three battles during the First World War * [[719 Albert]], Amor asteroid
==Military== * [[Battle of Albert (1914)]], a WWI battle at Albert, Somme, France * [[Battle of Albert (1916)]], a WWI battle at Albert, Somme, France * [[Battle of Albert (1918)]], a WWI battle at Albert, Somme, France
==Brands and enterprises == * [[Albert (automobile)]], a 1920s British light car * [[Albert (motorcycle)]], a 1920s German vehicle brand * [[Albert (supermarket)]], a supermarket chain in the Czech Republic owned by Ahold Czech Republic * [[Albert Heijn]], the largest supermarket chain in the Netherlands * [[Albert Market]], a street market in The Gambia * [[The Albert]], a Grade II listed pub in London * The Albert, a version of the [[Adidas Tango 12]] football
==Other uses== * [[Albert E. Gator]], the mascot of the University of Florida Gators athletics teams * [[Congregation Albert]], a Reform synagogue in Albuquerque, New Mexico * [[The Albert (Detroit)]], formerly the Griswold Building, an American apartment block
== See also == * {{look from}} * [[Adalbert]], a German given name * [[Alberta (disambiguation)]] * [[Alberte]] (born 1963), a Danish singer and actress * [[Albertet]], a diminutive of Albert * [[Albertina (disambiguation)]] * [[Albertine (disambiguation)]] * [[Alberts (disambiguation)]] * [[Albret]], a seigneurie in Landes, France * [[Aubert]], an Anglo-Saxon surname
{{disambiguation|geo}}
